DOC.HEADLINE: Turkish police seize large amount of heroin

TEXT.P: Turkish police seize large amount of heroin
ANKARA, March 4 (Xinhua) -- Turkish police seized a large amount of heroin in eastern and southeastern Turkey in the past two days, the semi-official Anatolia news agency reported on Thursday.
The police seized 134.5 kg of heroin Thursday in an abandoned car in the eastern province of Van, according to the report.
Residents of an apartment complex who got suspicious of a car parked in their garage informed the police, said the report.
The police team searched the abandoned car with sniffer dogs and found 134.5 kg of heroin in concealed compartments.
The police later arrested two suspects who came to the parking lot to pick up the car, said the report.
Meanwhile, acting on a tip-off, the Turkish police stopped a truck at Hakkari-Van highway and found 117.9 kg of heroin in the vehicle in the southeastern province of Hakkari on Wednesday.
Turkey is a key transit route for smuggling drugs from Asia and the Middle East to markets in western Europe.
Turkish anti-narcotic teams seized 12.2 tons of heroin, 25.8 tons of hashish and 391,770 ecstasy pills in operations throughout the country in 2009, according to Anatolia.
